action.action-desc: Mr. Alford introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Defense to conduct a study on infrastructure used for B–2 aircraft at Whiteman Air Force Base, Missouri.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the B–2 to B–21 Cost Analysis Act.
Congress finds that Whiteman Air Force Base, Missouri, is likely one of the main operating bases for B–21 aircraft.

section.header: Study and report on B–2 aircraft infrastructure at Whiteman Air Force Base, Missouri
section.text: Not later than December 31, 2023, the Secretary of Defense, in coordination with the Secretary of the Air Force and the Comptroller General of the United States, shall submit to the Committees on Armed Services of the House of Representatives and the Senate a report that contains—

paragraph.text: the findings of a study on infrastructure used for B–2 aircraft at Whiteman Air Force Base, Missouri, including—

subparagraph.text: such infrastructure used to store fuel or weapons; and
any such infrastructure the Secretary of Defense determines will be used for B–21 aircraft; and

paragraph.text: recommendations, if any, relating to how such infrastructure could be repurposed—
